subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Gospels: Who Wrote Them and When?
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Gospels: Who Wrote Them and When?.

hook.text: Matthew, Mark, Luke, John. Four accounts of Jesus â€” but none were written by eyewitnesses. That surprises most people.

buildup.text: The Gospels were written between 70 and 100 CE, decades after Jesus. They were based on oral traditions.

discovery.text: Mark came first. Matthew and Luke copied from Mark and a lost source called 'Q.' John is radically different.

twist.text: Dozens of other gospels existed but were excluded. The four we have were chosen centuries later by church councils.

climax.text: The Bible didn't fall from heaven. It was assembled by humans over centuries of debate, politics, and theology.

punchline.text: Four Gospels survived from dozens. The Bible was assembled, not revealed.

quiz.question: When were the four Gospels written?
